paragraphs.body: Place all punctuation marks inside the quotation marks if they are part of the quoted material and outside if they are not. This practice is sometimes referred to as logical punctuation. This is more in keeping with a principle of minimal change. This punctuation system does not require placing final periods and commas outside the quotation marks all the time, but rather maintaining their original positions in (or absence from) the quoted material.

paragraphs.body: I believe, that we should revise this policy to adhere to the standard laws of English. When using punctuation after a quote, it should be placed before the last quotation. This will make the wiki look cleaner, because it will be easier to read and digest. For example: Did Aang say, "I'm going to make a difference this time"? does not look as great as Did Aang say, "I'm going to make a difference this time?". It seems almost more encyclopedic to follow the standard rules of English grammar. SixMoodyDwarves  Voltorb Is Back!  22:20, October 26, 2012 (UTC)
